WRITING.TITLE: Anxiety through the roof...
WRITING.TEXT: Ugh, sorry in advance if this is a bit long. Its 4:18am and I'm freaking out. So, I can never sleep and usually just lay in bed watching Netflix or playing on my phone. Instantly I was like "What cramps?" and he pointed to his stomach and I immediately felt my heart drop and my anxiety kick in. I asked him if he was nauseous and he said a little, so I instantly got out of bed and have been pacing and panicking for close to half an hour now. To my knowledge, we haven't been around anyone who has been ill and he did have Mexican food and sushi this weekend, sooo...food poisoning is a possibility but you know what I'm terrified of - that its something contagious. Im being tested for lupus and other autoimmune diseases, so its incredibly hard for me to tell if I've caught something or if its just a bad day for me. I run low-grade fevers for no good reason, have no appetite, my body hurts, and it feels like the flu. It comes and goes every couple of days, so I'm scared to catch even a cold right now. I have no idea how my body will react. We live in a one bedroom apartment, we're always kissing and hugging, sharing germs, etc. So if he DOES have something, I'm screwed. Plain and simple. He does occasionally have IBS attacks during the night sometimes, so maybe that's the case, but I don't know since he just fell back asleep after he said he was a little nauseous. Im trying my hardest to distract myself, but I'm so anxious and scared that I'm making myself feel sick. I've already taken an anti-emetic so hopefully it helps. I can't even lay in bed so I'm sitting out in the living room, praying to god he sleeps until 7:30, wakes up, and is fine. Ugh, so much for getting any sleep. I just want to cry :(
